citation.article-title: Lactobacillus kimchicus sp. nov., a β-glucosidase-producing bacterium isolated from kimchi
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus kimchicus sp. nov.
Lactobacillus kimchicus (kim.chi′cus. N.L. n. kimchium kimchi; L. masc. suff. -icus suffix used with the sense of pertaining to; N.L. masc. adj. kimchicus pertaining to kimchi, isolated from kimchi).
Cells are slender rods, 0.3–0.8×1.0–2.0 µm when grown on MRS agar at 37 °C, and occur singly, in pairs or, occasionally, in short chains.
After 2 days on MRS agar, colonies are white, round to convex and smooth with entire edges, approximately 0.8–1.5 mm in diameter.
Oxidizes glucose to d-lactic acid, but not l-lactic acid.
Grows well under both aerobic and strictly anaerobic conditions on liquid and solid MRS medium.
Grows at 15 and 45 °C (optimum 37 °C), but not at 4 or 50 °C, at pH 6.0–7.0, but not at pH 5.0 or 9.0, and with 8 % (w/v) NaCl, but not with 10 % (w/v) NaCl.
Produces β-glucosidase based on aesculin hydrolysis on MRS agar.

Produces acid from N-acetylglucosamine, l-arabinose, arbutin, aesculin, d-fructose, d-galactose, gluconate, glucose, maltose, mannitol, d-mannose, ribose and d-xylose, but not from d-adonitol (ribitol), amygdalin, d-arabinose, d- or l-arabitol, cellobiose, dulcitol (galactitol), erythritol, d- or l-fucose, gentiobiose, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, inulin, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, lactose, d-lyxose, melezitose, melibiose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl β-d-xyloside, raffinose, salicin, sorbitol, l-sorbose, starch, sucrose, d-tagatose, trehalose, turanose, xylitol or l-xylose.
The major polar lipid is phosphatidylethanolamine and minor amounts of phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol are found.
The G+C content of the type strain is 39.7 mol%.
The type strain, DCY51T ( = KCTC 12976T = JCM 15530T), was isolated from kimchi collected in Gyeonggi province in South Korea.
